episodeTitle: Heat Haze Duel! Ace vs. Scorpion Man
episodeTitleJapanese: 陽炎の決闘！エースVS男スコーピオン
episodeTitleRomanized: Kagerou no Kettou! Ace vs Otoko Scorpion
description: As the Straw Hats journey through the Arabasta desert with Ace, a bounty hunter named Scorpion appears, claiming to have defeated Blackbeard. Ace confronts the bounty hunter to verify this claim, only to discover it was a ruse to lure him out. After defeating Scorpion and saving him from a landslide, Ace departs from the crew to continue his pursuit of Blackbeard, leaving Luffy with a mysterious piece of paper that will help them reunite in the future.

events.title: Scorpion's Debut
events.description: A bounty hunter named Scorpion appears in the Arabasta desert, watching the Straw Hat crew travel with Ace. Scorpion is accompanied by his ostrich-like bird companion Popo and is revealed to have two sons, Chip and Dip, living in the badlands.
events.significance: Introduces the anime-original antagonist for this filler episode. Scorpion serves as a catalyst to demonstrate Ace's power and personality before his departure from the crew.

events.title: Scorpion's Motivation Revealed
events.description: Scorpion reveals that he is hunting Ace because he heard rumors that someone named Scorpion defeated Blackbeard in the town of Yuba. Ace becomes interested, as he has been searching for Blackbeard throughout Arabasta.
events.significance: Establishes the false premise that drives the episode's conflict. This also reinforces Ace's ongoing mission to hunt down Blackbeard, which is central to his character arc.

quotes.text: The person who defeated Blackbeard in Yuba was called Scorpion.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace explaining why he has business with Scorpion

events.title: Ace vs. Scorpion Battle Begins
events.description: Scorpion ambushes Ace with various weapons including a steel net launcher and the Prescorraci Rifle, a backpack-mounted weapon capable of shooting acid, bombs, and steel nets. Ace easily deflects these attacks, demonstrating his superior combat abilities.
events.significance: Showcases Ace's combat prowess and Devil Fruit abilities in action. The one-sided nature of the battle emphasizes the gap between a Whitebeard Pirates division commander and a desert bounty hunter.

events.title: Ace Uses Hiken to Save Scorpion
events.description: When a landslide threatens to crush Scorpion and his two sons, Ace intervenes and uses his Hiken (Fire Fist) technique to destroy the falling rocks, saving their lives. This display of power and compassion demonstrates Ace's heroic nature.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's signature technique and reveals his compassionate character, willing to save even those who attacked him. This moment parallels Luffy's own tendency to help others regardless of their previous actions.

events.title: Scorpion's True Purpose
events.description: After being defeated and saved by Ace, Scorpion reveals that he lied about defeating Blackbeard to lure Ace out and challenge him. His true goal was to inspire his sons to follow their dreams by challenging a powerful warrior, teaching them that even ordinary people can face great challenges.
events.significance: Adds depth to the filler character and presents a positive message about pursuing dreams and challenging oneself, which aligns with One Piece's central themes. Scorpion's motivation resonates with the series' emphasis on ambition and courage.

quotes.text: Even the most insignificant person can still challenge the world's greatest hero if he tries hard enough!
quotes.speaker: Scorpion
quotes.context: Scorpion explaining his philosophy to his sons

events.title: Ace Decides to Leave the Crew
events.description: After learning that Blackbeard is not in Arabasta, Ace decides to depart from the Straw Hat crew and continue his pursuit. The crew says their goodbyes, with Nami and Vivi expressing admiration for Ace's manners compared to Luffy.
events.significance: Marks the end of Ace's brief journey with the Straw Hats, a mostly anime-original addition to the Arabasta arc. This departure sets up the crucial Vivre Card exchange that follows.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami commenting on how politely Ace eats compared to Luffy

events.title: Ace Gives Luffy His Vivre Card
events.description: Before departing, Ace gives Luffy a mysterious piece of paper, explaining that it's a Vivre Card made from his fingernail. He tells Luffy that no matter what happens, the card will always point toward him, and they can use it to meet again when they both reach higher levels in their pirate journeys. Ace explains the card's special properties: it's waterproof, fireproof, and will always guide Luffy to him.
events.significance: This is the most significant moment in the episode and one of the most important in the entire Arabasta arc. The Vivre Card becomes crucial during the Impel Down and Marineford arcs, where it guides Luffy to Ace's location and shows his deteriorating condition. This seemingly small gift sets up one of the series' most emotional storylines. The card burning away as Ace weakens in Impel Down creates urgency for the rescue, and its complete disintegration upon Ace's death becomes a devastating visual symbol of his loss.

quotes.text: It will help us meet again at the top.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace explaining the purpose of the Vivre Card to Luffy

quotes.text: This piece of paper will always point toward me, no matter where I am.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace describing how the Vivre Card works

events.title: Ace Departs from the Straw Hats
events.description: Ace bids farewell to Luffy and the Straw Hat crew, setting off alone to continue tracking Blackbeard. The crew watches as he disappears into the desert, continuing their own journey toward Alubarna. This marks the last time Luffy sees Ace before the Summit War.
events.significance: This departure is bittersweet in retrospect, as this is the last peaceful interaction between Luffy and Ace. The next time they meet, it will be under dire circumstances during the Impel Down and Marineford arcs. The warm farewell contrasts sharply with the tragedy that follows.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the strong bond between Ace and Luffy. Ace's gift of the Vivre Card symbolizes his desire to maintain their connection despite their separate journeys. Scorpion's relationship with his sons Chip and Dip parallels this, showing a father's desire to inspire and protect his children.
themes.symbolism: The Vivre Card serves as a physical representation of the unbreakable bond between brothers, literally keeping them connected across any distance.

themes.description: Scorpion's motivation to challenge Ace, despite knowing he would lose, embodies the One Piece theme that anyone can pursue their dreams regardless of their strength or status. His desire to teach his sons this lesson aligns with the series' central message about following one's ambitions.
themes.symbolism: Scorpion's challenge represents the courage to face impossible odds in pursuit of one's goals.

themes.description: Despite being attacked, Ace shows mercy and saves Scorpion and his sons from the landslide. This mirrors Luffy's own tendency to help others even after conflict, reinforcing the brothers' shared values.
themes.symbolism: Ace's use of his fire powers to save rather than destroy demonstrates the positive application of strength.

characterSpotlights.development: This episode showcases Ace's combat abilities, compassion, and his deep bond with Luffy. His gift of the Vivre Card demonstrates his desire to maintain their brotherly connection despite their separate paths. His continued pursuit of Blackbeard foreshadows the tragic events to come.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Scorpion battle and storyline is anime-original filler content. In the manga, Ace's departure happens much earlier, right after he destroys the Baroque Works ships and gives Luffy the Vivre Card. The anime extended Ace's time with the crew across several episodes (98, 99, 101, 102).

The Vivre Card exchange and explanation occurs in the manga in Chapter 159 but with a different context. In the manga, it happens at the port after Ace defeats the Billions. In the anime, it occurs in the desert after the Scorpion encounter.

trivia.fact: This episode has a TV rating of 13.9%, ranking 7th in viewership for its broadcast week.

Episode 101 is one of four anime-only filler episodes (98, 99, 101, 102) that extend Ace's journey with the Straw Hats in the Arabasta desert. Despite being mostly filler, it contains the crucial canon moment of Ace giving Luffy the Vivre Card.
The Vivre Card introduced in this episode becomes one of the most important plot devices in One Piece, playing a crucial role in the Impel Down and Marineford arcs over 350 episodes later.
Scorpion's character design includes an arrow-heart tattoo on his forehead and a black helmet with a red scorpion emblem, making him visually distinctive among anime-original characters.
The episode's Japanese title uses 'Kagerou' (陽炎), which means 'heat haze' or 'shimmering air,' appropriate for the desert setting where the battle takes place.
